full_text: Q. What is your full, true and correct name? A. JAMES WO YEE. Q. Have you ever used any other name? A. My marriage name is YEE SOOT WO. Q. When have you used the name JAMES WO YEE? A. Since 1952. Q. When and where were you born and of what country are you a citizen? A. January 20, 1900 in Tai On Village, Tai On Heung, Toishan District, China and I am a citizen of the United Kingdom and Colonies. Q. How did you become a citizen of the United Kingdom and Colonies? A. I was naturalized in Trinidad on September 9, 1952. Q. Are you married or single? A. I am married. Q. What is your wife's name, place of birth and citizenship? A. YEE YIP is her maiden name, and she is now using as her marriage name YIP YEE WO. She was born in Toishan District, China, I do not know the name of the village. She is a citizen ofIthe United Kingdom and Colonies. Q. Have you been married before your present marriage? A. Yes. Q. When, where and to whom were you married? A. I was first married in 1920 in my native village to GIN SHEE. Q. How was this marriage terminated? A. She died in 1959 in Trinidad. Q. When did you marry your second wife? A. March 12, 1960 in Trinidad to YEE YIP. Q. Do you have any children? A. I have 4 children by my first marriage and none by the second marriage. Q. Where do these children live and what is their citizenship? A. One is a citizen of Trinidad and the other three are citizens of the United Kingdom and Colonies. They are all living in Trinidad. Q. How many times have you been to the United States? A. I was here 4 times - in 1955 as a transit and in 1962, 1964 and 1965 as a visitor. D. Did you depart in 1955, 1962 and 1964 when requested to do so by the Immigration Service? A. Yes. -2-
